programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan and his team at London Road have to deal with a grand bone china dinner service, an 18 carat gold bracelet and a tiny Cartier bear with a huge price tag.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan considers an Olympic football signed by the Team GB women and a 200-year-old picture with a royal connection. A monster sound system attracts the team in Brighton.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two sets of first-time buyers - Isobel Phillips and Chris Martin, who were desperate to find their dream family home in the Cotswolds before getting married, and Claire Winship, a student looking to spend her £1.7million budget on a riverside apartment on London's South Bank.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Hampshire, where former naval officer Colin Nugent and wife Gillian are hoping to buy their first home after 23 years of marriage and 12 relocations with the military. Meanwhile, Army captain Ian Bellamy will be leaving the forces and is looking for a new house with girlfriend Diane Pittard.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Amanda and Clive want to leave Bromley for West Sussex with their dog Lulu, so Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help them spend their £1.25million budget wisely.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London, owned by actor and antiques dealer, Robert Gray. Alas, Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym fanatic Sophia Pottinger hosts the first dinner party of the week in south-east London, and has confidence in her simple, classic menu with dancing to follow. Sitting at her table are rock singer Francesca Santamaria, man-about-town Amadin Ryan, straight-talker Maria Eltheriouri and competitive cook Fraser Devlin.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Fraser Devlin hosts the second party from south-east London, and hopes his expertly cooked meal will land him the £1,000 prize. As well as organising entertainment for the evening, the host unexpectedly finds himself part of it.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock singer Francesca Santamaria serves a music-inspired menu at the third party in south-east London, including starter Prawn to Be Wild and dessert Sweet Child of Wine. Her guests like the names but some are put off by the idea of fancy dress, and the discovery of a portfolio of revealing pictures prompts a surprise disclosure.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in south-east London sees host Amadin Ryan pulling out all the stops to impress his guests with a Victorian banquet. He seems to deliver the goods, but the extensive preparations keep him away from the table for most of the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Maria Eltheriouri hosts the final night of the competition in south-east London, preparing a Greek-themed menu of meze, moussaka, and a marshmallow, chocolate and passion fruit mousse. In a bid to win, she ramps up the entertainment, with all the diners enjoying a dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Loudonville, Ohio, to rescue Landoll's Mohican Castle, a custom-built, multimillion-dollar hotel set in an 1100-acre woodland estate. Co-owner Marta is struggling, having been left with the entire burden of running such a large establishment alone. Can Gordon persuade her son Jimmy to finally take the reins and turn this business around before the family legacy is destroyed?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bob's in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou gets stopped in his tracks test driving a £30,000 Radical racing car, memorabilia expert Lawrence Pickett deals with an intriguing enquiry about a piece of pop art, while handbag expert Claudia Valentin is moved to tears by a client with an emotional story. James also values a tiara belonging to a martial arts fan, which could be worth £40,000.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: An elephant calf is born at Chester Zoo, but its young half-sister doesn't welcome the new arrival. Meanwhile, Bush dog dad Franco is under pressure as its family grows, and an onager - a rare type of wild horse - faces a major operation.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: One Killer Punch
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the consequences of deadly single hits, from a row over a parking space in a supermarket car park to an unanticipated fight outside a nightclub. By examining three different assaults, the film shows that a single punch can have a colossal effect, often in innocuous locations and circumstances. The programme hears from three accidental killers and observes the circumstances that led up to a fatal punch, how their lives have changed, how their guilt affects them and the complex emotional journey that follows.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio are in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Professional singer Precious seeks romance with amateur magician Earle. The restaurant also welcomes company director John, who hopes fellow Scot Greig is the man he can settle down with. And fellow diner Hebe is on the verge of giving up on finding Mr Right. Hopefully she will connect with fine wine merchant Charles.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring The Spy Who Loved Me, Andrew Neil with Jeremy Corbyn, the SNP's Manifesto, Paul Hollywood's Continental Road Trip, the Green Party and SNP's Party Election Broadcasts, Your Face or Mine, Great British Skinny Dip and the News.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Wolverhampton DJ Darryl hopes stripping everything back will him meet his ideal partner, while former ballet dancer Ania, from Preston, is tired of investing valuable time on people only to be disappointed when the clothes come off and has decided that being upfront is the key to relationship success. Anna Richardson hosts.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwicks in London, Nathan John Finch and Debs Franklin are doing deals on a pair of original fish paintings and an original theatre organ with a £35,000 asking price.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In south east London, Nathan and Debbs are taken aback by a ventriloquist's dummy, while in Sheffield, Dan appraises a classic campervan and considers one of his biggest ever deals.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who were expecting babies when they first met him. In 2009, Rik and Helen Francis wanted to change their city-centre living in Manchester for a move to a family home in Hale and Altrincham. In 2004, Alison and Phil Clarke were hoping to move from Bolton to Herefordshire to be nearer their relatives.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer helps art director Ben and screenwriter Lucy find a home in south London on a budget of £295,000, while fellow first-time buyers Cat and Ed in west London receive assistance from Kirstie Allsopp in tracking down their perfect property in an expensive area.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Retired engineer Barry and his Maltese-born partner Pauline search for a property in Suffolk, on a budget of £425,000. Presented by David Bull and Kirsty Duffy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week comes from the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich, Kent, with hosts Jan and Les Fisher convinced their traditional place will impress the others.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Jen Edwards throws the first in a series of parties in Swansea, but despite claiming to be a confident cook, she fumbles with her choice of starter. After overcoming trouble in the kitchen, the first course goes down well, and the host decides to get her guests to work up an appetite for dessert with a Zumba dance workout.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher James Knight hosts a school-themed party in Swansea, complete with children's games and bangers and mash. As well as entertaining his guests, James will have to keep tensions between Karen and Jen to a minimum if he is to stand a chance of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby player Keith Larrard hosts as the competition in Swansea reaches the midway point. He hopes to impress his guests with a Jackson 5 theme and a naked butler, but his guests are confused by a cryptic menu with dishes including Shoulder Sheep Sh'Moan.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Karen Wood hosts the fourth dinner party challenge in Swansea and hopes to impress not only with her buffet-style menu, but also by providing a hot tub. However, the diners' mixed expectations about her cooking skills, together with a series of mishaps during the day, mean the outcome is far from certain.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Katherine Waldemar Brown hosts the final party of the competition in Swansea, and asks her guests to adhere to a tarts-and-vicars dress code. She hopes her sophisticated menu will impress her fellow diners, but the evening is threatened by their unruly behaviour. The winner of the £1,000 prize is then announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt are joined by guest presenter Kiran Jethwa to investigate the latest dietary trends and scientific advances in the world of weight loss. In Los Angeles, Kate looks into reports that caffeine could be a powerful weapon in the battle of the bulge, while Jimmy heads to Belgium on the trail of chocolate that is packed with bacteria that are supposed to keep people healthy.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The East Midlands is the focus of this week's house-hunting, as Kirstie Allsopp joins Sam and Becky, who have a £100,000 budget and are looking for a house in Nottingham with a sizeable plot of land. Phil Spencer is with Nigel and Jane, who sold their home in Australia and moved back to the UK when Nigel was diagnosed with early onset dementia. But despite being back for months, they have struggled to find a property that lives up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Premiere. Biopic of the Kray brothers, exploring their rise to power in the London underworld and conflicts with rival gangs from the point of view of Reggie's wife Frances, who remains devoted to her husband even as he remains equally bound to his brutal, unstable sibling. Starring Tom Hardy as both twins, with Emily Browning, Christopher Eccleston and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: Documentary charting in detail the events leading up to the killing of Stacey Mackie in January 2012. Stacey ended her friendship with Terrence Armer, who became abusive and threatening, culminating in his gaining entry to her flat, dousing her in white spirit and setting her alight. The programme features interviews with Stacey's mother and sister and a detective inspector from Cumbria police force, as well as expert analysis from a criminal psychologist.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Franky asks Jianna's son to help prove her innocence, and Liz's decision to testify against Sonia has serious repercussions in court. Drama, starring Nicola da Silva.(n)

programme.title: One Punch Killers
programme.desc: Cameras follow Aaron Roach Bridgeman as he hears from the families of people who died after being struck just once by an assailant, and investigates the science behind the violence to find out exactly how a single punch can kill. He also tracks down the perpetrator of one of these attacks to get his side of the story, and brings him together with the mother of the man he killed to find out if she can ever truly forgive him for the death of her son.(n)

programme.title: South Park

Meanwhile, officers in north Wales try to recover the £2,000 owed by a tradesman to a former employer, and in Kent agents chase £8,000 owed by a jewellery shop to two former employees.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie plays a final desperate card by arranging for someone to try to persuade Sonya to rebuild their broken family. Steph discovers Leo's intention for Sonya's nursery.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hunter and Olivia's attempts to cheer up VJ backfire, Roo tells James she is keeping the baby, while Kat admits to Marilyn she is having trouble with Luc living in her home.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Christi and Kelly's persistent meddling in Melissa's private life sends the soon-to-be bride over the edge. Abby choreographs a gritty group number to raise awareness of the plight of the homeless, while school principal Holly takes a leave of absence to dedicate herself to her daughter Nia's dance career.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael's sister stays for the weekend and ruins the Kyles' domestic bliss by criticising Jay, making fun of everything from her weight and cooking to her talent as a singer.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie plays a final desperate card by arranging for someone to try to persuade Sonya to rebuild their broken family. Steph discovers Leo's intention for Sonya's nursery.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Zac begs Leah to give him another chance, Hunter realises he is being too hard on VJ, while John is involved in a fight in jail, but his spirits lift when Marilyn visits with news.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Part two of two. Abby Lee Miller joins blogger Nadine Rajabi and comedian Alec Mapa to dish more dirt, while fans of the show tweet questions and make their feelings known.(n)

programme.title: Shannon Matthews: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The disappearance of Shannon Matthews was a story that gripped and then appalled Britain. Nine years on, this documentary examines her kidnapping and why people close to the case believe the police should reopen their investigation. Featuring the insight of some of those closest to the case, the programme charts the impact on an innocent girl caught in the lies and greed of those who were supposed to be caring for her.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: The heartbreaking story of young couple Sophie and Robert, who were the victims of a vicious attack because they dressed like Goths.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Everyone decides to go gluten-free after bad things happen to a scientist who believes the substance is fine.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman hatches a plan, but Wendy has something to say about it. Meanwhile, Randy starts to feel the pressure of harbouring a secret.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars as the mysterious preacher determined to stop ruthless landowners from stealing the land of a group of poor gold miners(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sci-fi sequel in which a team of astronauts returns to Earth, having become the first human beings to walk on Mars. But they are unaware of the deadly stowaway on board - Eve , a clone of the original alien hybrid, who once again threatens the human population with her seductive powers(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: In this fingernail-biting suspense film, a young cop (Denzel Washington) busts an infamous psycho who, when in prison, becomes totally devoted to avenging his incarceration by evening the score with his captor. When the psycho killer escapes, he is after Washington(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: Screenwriter Nicholas Kazan and director Michael Apted combine elements of the hit films Sleeping With the Enemy and Double Jeopardy in this domestic thriller starring actress and recording artist Jennifer Lopez. "J. Lo" stars as Slim, a working-class diner waitress who accepts a date with the dashing Mitch (Bill Campbell), a successful building contractor who warns her about the insincere attentions of another suitor. Swept off her feet by Mitch, Slim soon marries him and gives birth to a daughter, Gracie (Tessa Allen). Her new life of suburban privilege seems idyllic for a few years until Slim discovers that Mitch is a serial philanderer. After his abuse becomes physical, Slim first seeks refuge with a battered woman's group then creates a new identity in another city, but she soon learns that there is no hiding from the resourceful Mitch, who is always able to track her down. After receiving little help from the father (Fred Ward), who abandoned her years ago, or the unsympathetic legal system, Slim resorts to martial arts lessons and a calculated campaign of payback designed to rid her and Gracie of the violent Mitch's presence forever. Enough co-stars Juliette Lewis, Noah Wyle, and Dan Futterman(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Lincoln Rhyme is a NY detective specializing in forensics and the leading crimimologist in the country. Following a near fatal injury in the line of duty, he is now only able to move his head, shoulders and one finger. Feisty street-smart policewoman Amelia Donaghy, is on her last night of duty before a transfer to a desk job when she is led to a crime scene and discovers a grossly mutilated corpse. Working with Lincoln on the case, she must be his eyes, ears and legs in order to solve the crime to crack the case before the killer strikes again(n)

programme.title: Just Cause
programme.desc: A legal expert whose days of trying cases are long behind him, Harvard Law School professor Paul Armstrong is moved by a plea he receives from a Florida death row inmate, Bobby Earl. It seems that the educated, upstanding Earl has been railroaded by an overeager sheriff zealously trying to solve the kidnapping and murder of a little girl(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A stranger steps in to save a pregnant woman from hitman Hertz. He delivers her baby and takes off, pursued by the killer and his henchmen. Supercharged actioner(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In the future, criminals are arrested before they have even committed their crime, thanks to the forecasting of 'pre-cogs'. Detective John Anderton thinks the system is perfect... until he's arrested. Brilliant sci-fi thriller based on a story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.

programme.title: Gran Torino

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Cinema One Global provides hours of entertainment for avid followers of Philippine movies, dramas and showbiz. Stay tuned to another great programme!(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: Biopic of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risks her life's savings to produce and market her invention, the Miracle Mop. The success of that product leads to a home-shopping empire and her ascension to matriarch of her family(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: When a horrific murder rocks the peaceful community of Holcomb, Kansas, legendary writer Truman Capote is inspired to record the shocking true story in his novel IN COLD BLOOD. Capote--accompanied by fellow wordsmith Nell Harper Lee (TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD)--travels to the Midwest in search of answers, and ends up becoming emotionally involved with one of the killers as they await trial(n)

programme.title: The Man Without a Face
programme.desc: Mel Gibson plays a disfigured outcast who forms a close bond with an emotionally neglected 12-year-old(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: One the most talked about and successful horror movies of all time. A priest is called to exorcise a powerful demon that has taken over a young girl. Oscar-winning adaptation of William Peter Blatty's shocking bestselling novel(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Office worker Wesley learns not only that his dad was a lethal hitman, but also that he's inherited the same skills(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust. Action(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him on a Pacific island(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Devon Sawa stars as Alex, a teenager whose premonition saves him from dying in an air disaster. But with Death keen to collect the souls of those who cheated him, can he foil the Grim Reaper twice?(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Castle looks into a mysterious death of a fan at a sci-fi convention, apparently killed by a genuine space laser, of which only two working examples exist. Away from the investigation, the event sees Beckett's love of the cult series Nebula 9 revealed. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Van Buren orders Briscoe and Green to reinvestigate unsolved cases, starting with the murder of a teenager 20 years previously. However, they discover much of the evidence gathered at the time has vanished, and the detective in charge of the case may have pursued an innocent man to protect the real culprit. An unexpected confession allows the case to end up in court again, but legal trickery makes a conviction an unlikely prospect.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man with a history of violence is arrested for the murder of his son's school ice-hockey coach, but pleads mitigating circumstances. Helped by a glib defence lawyer, he claims that he committed the crime while suffering from a previously unknown mental condition he calls `sports rage'.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.sub-title: And Here's to You, Mrs Azrael.
programme.desc: A teenager who was recovering from a car accident becomes the apparent victim of a mercy killing, forcing Hawkes to make an emotional return to the hospital where he used to work - and reminding him why he changed his career path from surgery to criminal investigation. Forensic drama, starring Hill Harper.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The CEO of a software company linked to a cyber-attack against the Department of Defence is kidnapped, and Kensi and Deeks go undercover to protect the man's family after fears over their safety. Meanwhile, Callen continues to research his past.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett and Castle witness the darker side of the music industry while investigating the case of an up-and-coming female DJ, whose corpse has been recovered from a skip. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Finch receives 38 numbers simultaneously from the Machine, each belonging to a different, high-ranking official inside HR, and discovers they are connected to an unknown player who is inciting a war between the corrupt police group and the Russian Mob. Meanwhile, Carter's past with her ex-husband is revealed. Sci-fi drama, starring Michael Emerson and Taraji P Henson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the death of Karen Hall, a staff member in the State Attorney General's Office, whose body has been found in the Hudson River - and her boss Frank Conroy quickly becomes a suspect. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a couple found dead in their apartment, following a trail of drugs and money to the wife of an army officer responsible for anti-narcotics operations in Colombia. Despite the woman's reluctance to co-operate with the police, McCoy convinces her she has no choice but to risk her life in a bid to catch the murderer. Charlotte d'Amboise guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack and Stella interrogate a congressman suspected of involvement in the murder of a drag queen. Danny and Mac look into the case of an extreme sports executive found dead in a gritter used to de-ice streets, and Lindsay heads for Montana to testify against a man who killed four of her friends. Drama, starring Anna Belknap and Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team uncovers an alliance between al-Qaeda and a Mexican drug cartel when it investigates a shoot-out at a pawn shop. As the agents explore the reasons behind the unusual coalition, a Mexican police chief with a vendetta against the Mendoza gang joins them.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Hetty enlists the help of a former colleague when an ex-Navy intelligence officer is murdered, but things go awry when her old friend threatens to kill her. The team races to save Hetty and expose her one-time workmate as having lied to the victim in order to make money from a seemingly charitable venture.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team targets a photographer with a secret life whose fantasies may have crossed into reality. Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detective Munch becomes personally involved in the prosecution of a terminally ill embryologist who is accused of assisting a depressed woman in committing suicide. Evidence points overwhelmingly to her guilt - but the jury finds it hard to decide her fate. Hard-hitting police drama, guest starring Marlee Matlin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate the murder of an elderly woman who they learn was dying of cancer but had been determined to live out her final days to the full - a philosophy that encompassed dating a variety of men. Discovering her most recent gentleman callers all have alibis, they turn their attention to the murder weapon and realise they are looking for a serial killer. Anthony Rapp and Jane Krakowski guest star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Public works employee Luis Valdez is found stabbed to death in a ditch by the side of a road. He had recently visited the locations of several unsolved murders, so a theory is proposed that Valdez was on to the killer and was murdered to keep him quiet. To build a case, the team re-examines the evidence of the cold cases, using modern techniques, but this prompts the serial killer involved to come out of retirement. Crime drama, starring Corey Stoll and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A DNA assessment of a kidnapping crime scene reveals horrifying results for Natalia, who discovers her sister Anya is one of a number of missing women. Racing to track her down, the team finds a collection of photographs that may hold the key to breaking the case. Starring David Caruso, Eva La Rue and Adam Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A woman is killed shortly after participating in a charity event, and it emerges that she had tried to reveal the involvement of its hosts with terrorists. As the team delves deeper into her mysterious world, a plot is uncovered that could put the entire city in danger. Starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Olinsky and his wife are targeted by a gang of heroin dealers after the unit carries out an undercover operation, while Erin makes her mind up about the federal task force position.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. Suspicion soon falls on the husband of one of the victims, who is revealed to have changed his identity to escape a shady past. The shop's security tapes are subsequently discovered in his flat, but the defendant surprises everyone by insisting on representing himself in court - and makes a big impression on the jury.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Animal rights activists are implicated in the death of an Aids researcher killed by a bite from an infected monkey, and use the ensuing court case to drum up support for their cause. As events unfold, McCoy and Carmichael find themselves debating ethics with lawyers who argue the protection of animal life is a valid defence in a murder case.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinister and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam goes undercover as a bomb specialist when he investigates the death of a demolition expert, killed while driving the car of a notorious club owner. However, he faces a race against time to find explosives located across LA. Meanwhile, Callen learns more about his past and Hunter decides to reshuffle her team.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Castle and Beckett investigate a case with many potential suspects after the founder of an adult-movie franchise is found dead, having been strangled with a bra. Meanwhile, a furious Castle discovers case details are being made public via Alexis' video blog.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest

Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a Hispanic man found dead from a severe chest trauma after being involved in a staged car accident with two other illegal immigrants - and soon find evidence linking similar incidents with the same employer, chiropractor and insurance adjuster. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a student who proves to be the estranged son of a powerful real-estate tycoon. However, Briscoe is not convinced, and suspects an extortion scheme.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
programme.desc: Directed by Mike Newell, the fourth installment to the Harry Potter series finds Harry (Daniel Radcliffe) wondering why his legendary scar -- the famous result of a death curse gone wrong -- is aching in pain, and perhaps even causing mysterious visions. Before he can think too much about it, however, Harry boards the train to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he will attend his fourth year of magical education. Shortly after his reunion with his best friends, Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson), Harry is introduced to yet another Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher: the grizzled Mad-Eye Moody (Brendan Gleeson), a former dark wizard catcher who agreed to take on the infamous "DADA" professorship as a personal favor to Headmaster Dumbledore (Michael Gambon). Of course, Harry's wishes for an uneventful school year are almost immediately shattered when he is unexpectedly chosen, along with fellow student Cedric Diggory (Robert Pattinson), as Hogwarts' representative in the Tri-Wizard Tournament, which awards whoever completes three magical tasks the most skillfully with a thousand-galleon purse and the admiration of the international wizard community. As difficult as it is to deal with his schoolwork, friendships, and the tournament at the same time (not to mention his feelings toward the ever unfathomable Professor Snape (Alan Rickman), Harry doesn't realize that the most feared wizard in the world, Lord Voldemort, is anticipating the tournament, as well(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club

programme.title: Letters to Juliet
programme.desc: Amanda Seyfried and Vanessa Redgrave star in Gary Winick's dreamy romantic drama. American magazine employee Sophie is on holiday in Italy with her husband-to-be Victor. In Verona, home of Shakespeare's star-cross'd lovers, she stumbles across a tradition whereby modern-day women cathartically leave notes about their love lives addressed to the fictional Juliet, and to which other modern-day women reply. The note that catches Sophie's eye is from an English woman, Claire, detailing her lost Italian love. Although the note's been there for decades, Sophie decides to respond, little realising that she's just taken the first step on a romantic journey of her own... Also starring Franco Nero and Christopher Egan. In English, and Italian and Spanish with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: With fresh memories of his family's slaughter by Red Leg soldier Terrill, Confederate Josey Wales refuses to join his captain Fletcher and the rest of his comrades in surrender to a U.S. Army regiment. programme.title: Young Guns
programme.desc: Action-packed Western: in the Old West, six young outlaws ride out to avenge the death of their mentor. Their personal mission turns into a bloody rampage and the gang are soon on everyone's 'most wanted' list(n)

programme.title: Young Guns II
programme.desc: Only three of the original five "young guns" -- Billy the Kid (Emilio Estevez), Jose Chavez y Chavez (Lou Diamond Phillips), and Doc Scurlock (Kiefer Sutherland) -- return in Young Guns II, which is the story of Billy the Kid and his race to safety in Old Mexico while being trailed by a group of government agents led by Pat Garrett (William Petersen). Along the way, Billy's crew gains three new recruits: Arkansas Dave Rudabaugh (Christian Slater), Tom O'Folliard (Balthazar Getty), and Hendry French (Alan Ruck). Though the film suffers from an uneven script, many performances -- particularly Slater's -- are surprisingly strong, and the movie looks great. The theme song, "Blaze of Glory," is performed by Jon Bon Jovi in his first solo appearance; the rocker also has a cameo in the film(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Director: Don Siegel. When a mad man calling himself 'the Scorpio Killer' menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Two men who have made a career out of spinning remarkable stories find themselves bringing them to life in this inventive fantasy inspired by the creators of some of the world's best-loved fairy tales. Will Grimm (Matt Damon) and his brother Jake Grimm (Heath Ledger) earn their living by traveling from village to village and vanquishing strange supernatural beasts that have been menacing the populace. Or at least that's what their clients think has been happening; as it happens, Will and Jake are confidence men who cleverly stage the ghostly attacks and then take payment for making the creatures they fabricated go away. One day, the brothers arrive in a town and offer to help its people drive away evil spirits, unaware that the community is bordered by a genuine enchanted forest, and that young girls in the village have been disappearing at a frightful rate. The Grimm Brothers must now learn how to deal with real magic, with the help of the lovely but fearless Angelika (Lena Headey). Directed by Terry Gilliam, The Brothers Grimm also stars Monica Bellucci, Peter Stormare, and Jonathan Pryce(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: A box office smash and written by Slyvestor Stallone as the version of 'Beverly Hills Cop' he wanted to make. Based on the novel 'Fair Game' and also stars Brigitte Nielsen(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: In the wake of the detonation of a 'dirty bomb' in LA and under the instruction of a public service announcement, Brad barricades himself within his home. With his wife Lexi on her way to work, he desperately tries to call her in an attempt to find out if she is safe and well. As time elapses and his worse fear looks set to manifest, Lexi appears outside the family home..(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Classic cop action with the legendary Clint in one of his greatest roles as 'Dirty' Harry Callahan. Harry investigates an underground group who seem to be killing famous faces. Dir: Buddy Van Horn(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Before Jayson Blair made headlines for his plagiarized New York Times reporting, Stephen Glass defamed the weekly current events magazine The New Republic with a series of eye-catching, entertaining, and completely fabricated stories. Now Glass' trail of lies gets the big-screen treatment in writer/director Billy Ray's Shattered Glass, featuring Hayden Christensen in the title role. The film chronicles Glass' time at the magazine in the late '90s, when his colorful coverage of a hedonistic Young Republican convention, superstar web hackers, and the circus surrounding the Bill Clinton/Monica Lewinsky scandal made him the toast of the publishing world, garnering attention from such national publications as George and Rolling Stone. Barely out of college, the eager Glass ingratiates himself with the office staff, including his mentor, managing editor Michael Kelly (Hank Azaria). But when Kelly is unceremoniously fired and replaced with editor Chuck Lane (Peter Sarsgaard), Glass' pieces come under a greater degree of scrutiny, until one in particular threatens to expose his tall tales to the rest of the world. Based in part on a Vanity Fair article by journalist Buzz Bissinger, Shattered Glass premiered at the Telluride and Toronto film festivals before its limited fall theatrical release(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: In this unsettling thriller, a working-class family man becomes convinced he's being haunted after he agrees to let his sister-in-law hypnotize him at a party. Later, both he and his son start to see the ghost of a missing local girl(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kirsten Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials

programme.title: Final Destination

Meanwhile, Herod Antipas (Jonathan Bailey) dispatches a Roman centurion (Sean Bean) to hunt down and kill the boy, whose miraculous powers might be a threat to his reign. The two share a connection, but is it wise for Father Michael to confide his own secrets to someone struggling to deal with their own?.(n)

The pair have a challenge on their hands as each member of the busy family have very different eating habits, meaning mum Stacy cooks 3 different dinners every night, including meals for her son Harry, who has Type 1 diabetes.(n)

programme.title: The Met: Policing London
programme.desc: Police deal with the stabbing of a young man in Hackney over a Bank Holiday weekend, but as he is taken to hospital another emergency call comes in, and a second stabbing has also taken place less than a mile away. Meanwhile, detectives from The Metropolitan Police's Sexual Offences Unit try to gather evidence against a man suspected of sexually assaulting a woman with Down's Syndrome, and police in South East London deal with staff in newsagents and supermarkets who have been targeted by masked gunmen.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with Laverne, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: For the birds and animals of the Highlands, the summer offers a chance to raise offspring before the days shorten and the storms of autumn arrive. Seabirds flock to the island of Handa off the Sutherland Coast, where 30,000 pairs of guillemots breed annually. Handa is also the location for a spectacular wild drama ending with the tiny chicks, known as jumplings, leaping for their lives from the 400-ft cliffs. Cameras also reveal life in the great rolling expanse of wetland known as the Flow Country, whose blanket peat bog stores more carbon than all of the forests in the entire UK.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. programme.title: The Chillenden Murders
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team looking into the killings of Lin Russell and her daughter Megan assess Michael Stone's second trial, and an alleged confession he made while in prison. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Journalist Jonathan Fryer meets his sister for the first time since he was adopted at 18 months of age, and they solve a long-standing mystery surrounding their mother.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Adrijan gets caught in a lie, angering distracted Superintendent McKay who covertly seeks to prevent a reformed youth being dragged back to crime.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how certain British ingredients make traditional combinations, preparing a pork and apple dish and a pear and Stilton tart. They also find out how Yorkshire pudding was made in the 1700s, and discover it was not originally served with beef.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: A baby elephant needs to be flown to Nairobi if it is to survive, while the herd's matriarch has developed a strong bond with the youngest orphan. Jonathan Scott investigates the disastrous impact of poaching, going on patrol with a team from the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust. Presented by Michaela Strachan.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.sub-title: Autumn and Winter - Against All Odds.
programme.desc: Ewan McGregor narrates as summer gives way to autumn and winter in the Highlands. From October to February, extreme weather is expected to batter the Cairngorm plateau. For the region's wildlife, these brutal, dark seasons trigger a game of endurance for which they must carefully prepare. Throughout the autumn, Scotland's reindeer bulls fight for dominance in ruts that can last for hours, and hurricane-strength winds lash a seal colony on Copinsay, where vulnerable pups must stay close to their mother if they are to have a chance of surviving. As winter arrives, the Highlands are blanketed in snow and ice, and while the frigid landscape retains its beauty, the moment of truth arrives for mountain hares, ptarmigan and golden eagles.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Helen Hall set off on a trip from Bristol, heading to Corsham and travelling through Bradford on Avon in Wiltshire in their search for treasures before ending up at an auction in Swindon, where they hope to sell their purchases for a profit.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Companion show to the main programme, as Chris Packham is joined by the broadcaster Sara Cox, dung expert Richard Jones, and Paralympic swimmer Ellie Simmonds.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. In Zermatt, Michael learns how intrepid early 20th century British mountaineers turns Alpinism into a fashionable sport, and at Martingny, Michael puts his faith in a St Bernard after he is buried in the snow.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales, returning chef Phil Carmichael and newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie, go all out to impress with their main courses. Each chef uses Welsh lamb as the centrepiece of their dish, showcasing a range of techniques and using an array of unusual ingredients to elevate their main courses to banquet level.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan catch up on all the wildlife action that has taken place over in the last 24 hours. Plus, a report by Martin Hughes-Games from Scotland as he goes on the trail of an animal architect, and Lucy Cooke presents another film demonstrating how a simple object can connect people to the natural world.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC Filmmaker Natalie Hewit spent three months in Antarctica following the work of the everyday heroes who have been challenged to move a vital polar research station, Halley VI. Built on the Brunt Ice Shelf, it sits far beyond the Antarctic shoreline, but a crevasse in the surrounding ice threatens to send the station adrift.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: When Vincent receives a visit from a tax inspector, pursuing him for unpaid tax, he decides that now would be a good time to get out of the showroom and spend some more time with his family. They take a trip to Southend, but it does not go exactly as they planned. Meanwhile, Fitzpatrick and Lavender clash over the ethics of Page 3 when a competition in The Sun newspaper arises, and Vincent's side-business, pirating copies on E.T on VHS in the backroom of the showroom, continues to roll out in his absence.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cosby: Fall of an American Icon
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of how US comedy giant and African-American role model Bill Cosby finally came to face a criminal trial for sexual assault a decade after the accusations were made, with proceedings set to start in Pennsylvania today. The film explores why it took so long for allegations that he was privately drugging and raping women with impunity to be taken seriously, with accusations from numerous women having fallen on deaf ears for years, and hears from journalists, co-stars and alleged victims.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes the high-speed line to Stratford in east London to explore the legacy of the Olympic Park and explores Spitalfields, an area of the city that has been home to many immigrants through the centuries. He ends this leg of his journey at Victoria underground station, where he finds out about the massive makeover currently under way.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley investigates how George II's family fought the French, the Jacobites and one another at the same time. She examines his troubles with his son Frederick, Prince of Wales, and the way he led from the front on the battlefield, becoming the last British monarch to do so, and helped turn the country into a global superpower.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Spicing Up Britain - How Eating Out Went Exotic.
programme.desc: Documentary examining how post-war Britain went from being a place where eating out was more of a chore than a pleasure to a nation full of foodies who on average spend up to a third of their food budgets on restaurant meals. The programme investigates how Brits' palates have been slowly introduced to a range of culinary delights that once would have been considered `exotic' by successive generations of migrants opening eateries. Narrated by Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: The Secret History of My Family
programme.desc: The documentary charting social history by exploring different family trees continues with the story of Lavinia and Florence, two Victorian women from opposite ends of the social scale who were brought together by domestic violence. One was desperate to feed her six children in 1880s London, the other came from a lavish county home and ventured into the slum to help a fellow mother. The film tells the saga of a woman from the workhouse whose descendant ended up at Eton and a family from the landed gentry who threw off the burden of their past.(n)

programme.title: Storm Troupers: The Fight to Forecast the Weather
programme.desc: Alok Jha investigates how meteorology became one the most important scientific endeavours of the modern age by charting the progress of computer-based forecasting through the characters who pioneered it. He reveals how American mathematician Jule Charney found a way to simplify weather for the early computers of the 1940s, and looks at how John Mason gambled the future of the Met Office on unproven technology in the early 1960s. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inside Einstein's Mind: The Enigma of Space and Time
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates a docudrama exploring the story behind Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity, which turned science's understanding of gravity, space and time on its head when it was published in November 1915. The film takes viewers on a visual journey that begins in Einstein's young mind, follows the thought experiments that gave him stunning insights about the physical world and ultimately reaches the extremes of modern physics.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Biologist Lynn Rogers uses a controversial technique - giving food to wild black bears to gain their trust - and follows a family of four of the animals over a year in and around the forests of northern Minnesota. He aims to provide an intimate portrait of the lives and habits of these creatures.(n)

programme.title: The Secret History of My Family
programme.desc: The documentary charting social history by exploring different family trees continues with the story of Lavinia and Florence, two Victorian women from opposite ends of the social scale who were brought together by domestic violence. One was desperate to feed her six children in 1880s London, the other came from a lavish county home and ventured into the slum to help a fellow mother. The film tells the saga of a woman from the workhouse whose descendant ended up at Eton and a family from the landed gentry who threw off the burden of their past.(n)

programme.title: Storm Troupers: The Fight to Forecast the Weather
programme.desc: Alok Jha investigates how meteorology became one the most important scientific endeavours of the modern age by charting the progress of computer-based forecasting through the characters who pioneered it. He reveals how American mathematician Jule Charney found a way to simplify weather for the early computers of the 1940s, and looks at how John Mason gambled the future of the Met Office on unproven technology in the early 1960s. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to London's West End as he explores 19th-century engineering used in theatres, and learns about the ambitious building programme that saw Trafalgar Square replace slums. He indulges in some retail therapy at a Piccadilly Circus perfumery patronised by kings, queens and prime ministers, and finds out how diseases were rife in Victorian London on a visit to Soho.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Built the Liners.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hard-working culture that existed in the Clyde shipyards, which were responsible for making the Queen Mary and QE2, despite poor working conditions and industrial relations. The programme examines how the employees' work ethic and strength of public support led them to defy the then-government's efforts to close the factories down in 1971.(n)

programme.title: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa
programme.desc: Michael Sheen takes the lead role in a drama based on Kenneth Williams' diaries. The film charts the comic actor's professional successes, which included the Carry On series, radio programmes such as Round the Horne and numerous TV appearances. It also delves behind the laughter to explore the actor's problems, insecurity and self-doubt.(n)

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: In a programme first broadcast in 1995, Michael Parkinson looks back at memorable moments from his interviews with actor Kenneth Williams. Among other topics, the Carry On star discusses his dislike of theatre critics, and reveals his grievances with Parkinson himself. He also performs a rendition of My Crepes Suzette. With appearances by John Betjeman, Maggie Smith, Frank Muir, Tom Lehrer, Robin Ray and Patrick Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Locomotion: Dan Snow's History of Railways
programme.desc: The historian and broadcaster charts the development of the UK's rail network, from its beginnings as a primitive system of trackways for coal carts in the early 18th century up to the present day. Rapid industrial growth during the 19th century, coupled with the prospect of vast profits, drove inventors and entrepreneurs to develop steam locomotives, metal tracks and an array of daring tunnels, cuttings and bridges that created a nationwide system of railways in just 30 years. George Stephenson's Liverpool and Manchester Railway became the model for future inter-city travel and his fast, reliable locomotive the Rocket began a quest for speed that has defined the modern world.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 719. Veteran and military spouse entrepreneurs try to drum up support. programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra grudgingly agrees to let Ray have more involvement in the daily decision-making process, giving him the freedom to shop for grocery items he likes and choose where the family will go on holiday. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra, Ray and Amy get trapped at Frank and Marie's house during a snowstorm, but they actually find themselves having a good time - until an unguarded comment alters the mood. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Monica Horan.(n)

programme.desc: Niles tries to reclaim his luxury apartment but finds obstacles in his path, including a tap-dancing grief counsellor and wary neighbours. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bob's in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late.(n)

programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps nurses Philip Vaux and Alec Billen from Somerset search for a holiday home in Almeria, south Spain, showing them properties from a townhouse to a country pad.(n)

programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Edinburgh compete to win the £1,000 prize, including competitive couple Kenny and Lisa, who believe their dishes are good enough to be served in a restaurant. Later, duo Julie and Keith hope to get away with preparing two very similar courses, before final hosts Kate and Mike hope to impress their rivals with a Tex-Mex menu.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In south east London, Nathan and Debbs are taken aback by a ventriloquist's dummy, while in Sheffield, Dan appraises a classic campervan and considers one of his biggest ever deals.(n)

programme.desc: American musician Jimmy Osmond joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, as Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host the popular words-and-numbers game.(n)

programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Kerr Drummond help Lesley and Ian find the perfect holiday house in Dorset for their £500,000 budget, but it remains to be seen which location they opt for.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge breaks her leg in a skiing accident and has to recover in hospital - so Lisa volunteers to take over as head of the household until she is well again. Unfortunately, Bart and Homer prove so awkward and unhelpful that she is driven to desperate measures.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Yasmine asks Esther for some part-time work, just as her sister Farrah turns up on the back of a motorbike. Elsewhere, Adam and Maxine get a welcome home shock, and Harry is alarmed when he visits Ste.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: New series. Chef Michel Roux Jr and a panel of food experts blind taste-test some of the nation's favourite food and drink. Joining the host is restaurant manager and First Dates' Fred Sirieix, journalist, broadcaster and critic Jay Rayner, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart, and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The products tested are apple pie, Scotch whisky, and lamb shanks. Plus, members of the public vote for the tastiest baked beans.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: New series. Anna Richardson and Andi Osho return with the consumer show filled with money-saving shopping tips and revelations. This first episode visits the snack aisle and finds out that Lidl isn't as cheap as some might expect. They also examine whether Holland & Barrett are good value for money, and have a glimpse of the future with one-hour supermarket delivery.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Midwife Sarah and partner Stephen look forward to the arrival of their twins at Liverpool Women's Hospital. Cameras also follow young couple Holly and Nick, who surprised her mum Michelle by announcing their planned pregnancy. Meanwhile, Tasha and Jonny come in to have their second child after a traumatic birth with their first baby, Nevaeh.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Professional singer Precious seeks romance with amateur magician Earle. The restaurant also welcomes company director John, who hopes fellow Scot Greig is the man he can settle down with. And fellow diner Hebe is on the verge of giving up on finding Mr Right. Hopefully she will connect with fine wine merchant Charles.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home.(n)

programme.title: Four to the Floor
programme.desc: Featuring artist Yellow Days, music from the Gospel House Choir, and an introduction to lovers rock performer Winston Brown.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: Stories include a man who changed the blade of his angle grinder with the motor running, and a lady who is harbouring a creature in her ear. Previously seen on E4.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: In America, the waters of Lake Erie turn pea green, while a man in New Zealand finds eels swimming in his street after a sudden and violent downpour. A photographer captures rare images of a moustache cloud, New York City grinds to a halt as onlookers witness the beautiful sunset known as `Manhattanhenge', and in Hawaii, volcanic lava creates tornados of steam on the ocean surface. A terrifying mudslide roars through a sleepy Austrian village, while wind and rain carve ancient rocks into giant mushroom-like shapes in Egypt.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly one-eyed South African porcupine Roxy is introduced to a new, younger male called Henning, in the hope that she will find companionship in her old age. Kifaru, the oldest eastern black rhino at Chester Zoo, meets younger female Malindi, with the expectation that they will produce offspring to increase the dwindling population, while the Caribbean flamingos are breeding again.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pioneering veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick plans to use groundbreaking cell technology to repair damaged cartilage in a 10-month-old golden retriever that helps a five-year-old girl cope with epilepsy. A cat arrives at the surgery with a suspected rat bite that seems to be getting bigger, and a whippet is brought in after being hit by a car - sustaining multiple pelvic fractures.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer helps art director Ben and screenwriter Lucy find a home in south London on a budget of £295,000, while fellow first-time buyers Cat and Ed in west London receive assistance from Kirstie Allsopp in tracking down their perfect property in an expensive area.(n)

programme.desc: Will returns from holiday in France and spends every moment with Grace, provoking Nathan's jealousy, and a proud Jack takes his son shopping. Woody Harrelson guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will's old adversary is hired to work at the law firm, filling him with the dread of renewed hostilities. Comedy, guest starring Woody Harrelson and Adam Goldberg.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert is offered a job with the FBI, but Marie's meddling ruins his chances and he refuses to forgive her for interfering. Brad Garrett and Doris Roberts star.(n)

Comedy, guest starring Virginia Madsen (Sideways) and Amy Brenneman (Private Practice).(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne agrees to marry Donny, but has a vision that suggests he is wrong for her, and tempts fate by turning to Niles for advice on how to proceed.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Shut Out in Seattle - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Daphne's engagement to Donny leaves Niles feeling down, so he seeks solace in the arms of a younger woman. Frasier keeps getting his girlfriend's name wrong, Martin's relationship with Bonnie turns sour, and Roz cannot bring herself to break up with Bulldog.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ian Snowley and Kay Marriot fell in love with the volcanic landscapes and coasts of Lanzarote, and are now determined to buy a house that they can use to explore the island further. Scarlette Douglas shows the couple five properties, hoping to maximise their budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Kent compete to win the £1,000 prize, including married West End performers Millie and Andy, who channel family roots to prepare a Greek Cypriot-inspired menu. Newlyweds Sam and Emma hope to wow their guests with a glamorous beef Wellington they have spray-painted gold, while dinner party enthusiasts Alex and Richard aim to impress by remaining calm, collected and on-the-ball as they host the final gathering.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick Pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick inspect a collection of boxing memorabilia owned by former boxing promoter Kellie Maloney, as well as an unusual electric unicycle. At London Road in Sheffield, Dan has a diamond encrusted bracelet in his sights, and is also considering deals on two high-end leather belts and a huge collection of coins featuring some of the world's most dangerous creatures.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.desc: Bart sets out to save Homer from the embarrassing effects of his latest misfortune, and does so well he becomes convinced he possesses miraculous healing powers. Featuring the guest voice of Don Cheadle (Iron Man 2).(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Maxine panics about a recent accusation even though Adam reassures Maxine that no one is going to believe that she has hit Toby. Elsewhere, Harry makes a dangerous decision, and Scott hassles Nancy for help with the summer fete but pushes her too far.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: New series. A six-part school drama series set in a Yorkshire mill town with a largely divided white and Asian population, as two formerly isolated comprehensive schools are merged into a brand new academy. In the first episode, English teacher Emma gets a shock when she finds out she's now working with her ex-boyfriend, while best friends and neighbours Missy and Nas attend school together for the first time.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after being involved in a road traffic collision, with consultants concerned that she may have life-threatening internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 80-year-old Mohammad has come to A&E after falling at home during a family Eid celebratory feast, and 56-year-old Russ is brought in after falling from a ladder while cutting back some trees at work.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: A worried Emmit asks his lawyer to investigate Varga, but an internet search leads to trouble for the attorney. Ray visits his brother in a seeming attempt to make peace with him, but is just creating a diversion while Nikki tries to steal the stamp. Gloria learns that Ennis wrote pulp sci-fi novels under the pseudonym Thaddeus Mobley, and also discovers that Maurice took a page from a phonebook with Ennis's information from the gas station that he stopped in on the night of the murder. Ewan McGregor and Carrie Coon star.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
