programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: The agents make a disastrous mistake during a mission, but a college lecturer helps to salvage the situation.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Hilda sees Anne climbing over Paul's garden fence and thinks she is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Janet is shocked at George's lack of reaction when he finds her in a compromising position with the handyman, but soon discovers something else that turns him green with jealousy - literally. Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce star.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret tries to take Victor's mind off his depressing situation by encouraging him to attend a fitness class and read a book on how to cope with old age. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg climbs a tree to prove a point, but finds getting down is not as easy. Meanwhile, the police investigate the case of a runaway cooker. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen a Peruvian Wart?.
programme.desc: Roy Barraclough guest stars as Crowcroft, a well-known Lothario with a preference for gullible women. When he samples Nora Batty's baking, he decides to make her his next target. Long-running comedy, with Kathy Staff, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The local council insists that Ben is disabled so he happily plays along with the mistake - until he comes to regret his actions. Comedy, guest starring Penelope Wilton, with Robert Lindsay, Zoe Wanamaker and Daniela Denby-Ashe.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Janet is shocked at George's lack of reaction when he finds her in a compromising position with the handyman, but soon discovers something else that turns him green with jealousy - literally. Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce star.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Hilda sees Anne climbing over Paul's garden fence and thinks she is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret tries to take Victor's mind off his depressing situation by encouraging him to attend a fitness class and read a book on how to cope with old age. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The local council insists that Ben is disabled so he happily plays along with the mistake - until he comes to regret his actions. Comedy, guest starring Penelope Wilton, with Robert Lindsay, Zoe Wanamaker and Daniela Denby-Ashe.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy becomes a yuppie, complete with red braces, Filofax and chrome briefcase. Meanwhile, Rodney begins attending a computer course at night school, where he meets Cassandra. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian visits Brighton Dome, where Al Murray as the Pub Landlord headlines tonight's showcase of stand-ups from the comedy circuit, supported by Micky Flanagan, Jo Caulfield and Jon Richardson.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: On the day of the christening, Mark travels to Zahra's flat to pick up Jeremy, the baby's godfather, but the friends finds themselves in a predicament when they become locked in the hallway. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Denise and Dave bring baby David to visit and Anthony and Darren do Ali G impressions. Award-winning comedy, starring Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.desc: Skits and sketches from comedy duo Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders, with guest star Jane Asher.(n)

programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey

programme.title: Citizen Khan

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance
programme.desc: The tale of a war veteran who rediscovers his talent for golf with the help of a mystical caddie. The veteran returns to his home town of Savannah after 15 years when his ex-girlfriend organises an ambitious competition in order to restore the fortunes of her debt-ridden golf resort. In order to defend the town's honour, the veteran takes part with the caddie's advice ringing in his ears(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: Ten amateur celebrity cooks, including Blur's Alex James, Boyzone's Keith Duffy and one-time EastEnders star John Partridge (Christian Clarke), board a cruise ship heading across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen. Their talents are judged by chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: In their final tutorial, Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry tackle the signature, technical and showstopping challenges from the last few weeks of the competition. Mary makes lemon and raspberry eclairs and double chocolate entremets, while Paul prepares a cherry and chocolate loaf, povitica and raspberry and chocolate doughnuts.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The final first-round heat sees five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a plate of food that showcases their culinary skills, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four try to impress Monica Galetti by preparing three canapes, after which Marcus Wareing asks them to make a spectacular crab dish. The judges then decide which three have earned a place in the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a dinner for two that is fit for a king, but doesn't cost the earth. They receive presentation tips from Michelin-starred chef Olivier Limousin and delve into Britain's rich history for cut-price culinary inspiration. Everything they learn is put to the test when they help single mother Paula say a big thank-you to her supportive parents.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Sainis from Sutton Coldfield, who are addicted to supermarket offers and have a tendency to over-indulge on snacks and sweet treats. They buy so many crisps in a single shop that Gregg is left wondering what they actually eat for dinner. The family are vegetarian, so dietician Lucy Jones looks at the nutritional difference between beef mince and soya mince, and Gregg visits a factory to find out how meat substitute is made - but can he and Chris persuade the Sainis to change their ways?.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: Ten amateur celebrity cooks board a cruise ship heading across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen. Their talents are judged by chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White. Each episode follows the untrained chefs as the ship sails from port to port and they discover charming and captivating stories about each location and the food that is grown and produced locally.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve contestants begin the battle to be named Britain's best amateur baker, facing tasks devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who have created 30 new tasks to test their baking skills and creativity. Their first signature challenge is to make a Madeira cake, before they attempt to bake a frosted walnut cake in the technical. Day two of the contest sees the contestants going all out to try and impress the judges with their first showstopper, the Black Forest gateau. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the fourth quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, William Sitwell and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate some of their favourite indulgent dishes for entertaining guests, receiving money-saving tips from Michelin-starred chef Tom Kitchin and delving into British culinary history for gourmet inspiration. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they help a lifeboat helmsman say a surprise thank you to his crew.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Austens from West Sussex, whose income has reduced by a third since mum Denise recently gave up work. However, the family are guilty of stockpiling food to the point where they cannot open the fridge door without items falling out - and they are utterly devoted to high-end brands, refusing to buy anything other than their favourite labels.(n)

programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the fourth quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, William Sitwell and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: World's Best Restaurants

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Austens from West Sussex, whose income has reduced by a third since mum Denise recently gave up work. programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

programme.desc: The third film in the Batman series, this film follows the caped crusader as he teams up with Robin. Joining up with The Riddler, the evil Two-Face discovers Batman's true identity and the pair threaten to take over Gotham City, the dynamic duo must find a way to stop him(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Semi-autobiographical tale from Spike Lee based on his childhood growing up in 70s New York. Young Troy watches her parents fight over money, and gets a chance to see how the other half lives when she visits wealthy cousins in the country(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in an Oxford college, where the academic and domestic staff do their best to push her enquiring mind down conventional educational routes and quell her tomboy tendencies; it's a losing battle. One day, having sneaked into a private meeting of the college's dons, Lyra learns of mysterious events taking place in the Arctic. Soon after, amid news of mysterious child abductors called the 'Gobblers', her best friend Roger vanishes. The fearless Lyra sets off, determined to rescue her playmate. But Lyra's is a parallel universe: one with VIctorian-style technology; where people's souls take the form of character-suggesting visible animals; witches and talking, armoured polar bears rule the cold lands of the north; and an organisation called The Magisterium aims to assert its authority over everyone. Lyra's journey will prove a dangerous one; one that uncovers the terrible truth that links the Gobblers and the Arctic phenomenon she heard about in the safety of Oxford. Also starring Eva Green, and the voices of Freddie Highmore and Ian McKellen. Sadly, it now looks as though the following two films in the series are fated not to be made. Even so, this stands as a stirring, thoughtful family adventure that's reasonably true to Pullman's masterpiece(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a fictional relationship between William Shakespeare and a young woman who poses as a man in order to star in one of the writer's plays. Suffering from writer's block, Shakespeare is in need of a new muse. He soon finds inspiration in the form of a beautiful female aristocrat, but her daring determination to act in his play puts their already forbidden relationship on even more dangerous ground(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe
programme.desc: An unhappily married woman retreats to an inn on the North Carolina coast, where she meets a doctor who's struggling with his own crisis of conscience(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: This Oscar-winning comedy drama stars Matt Damon as a mathematical genius, struggling to come to terms with his talent and the trauma in his life, and Robin Williams as the psychologist trying to help him. Will Hunting is a night janitor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology who hangs out with a tough-talking Irish-American crowd of buddies and hides the fact of his genius like a guilty secret. The secret is discovered by a professor who, when Will is ordered to undergo therapy for his aggression, introduces him to a psychologist who reaches out to the kid, learning much about his own pain in the process(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison in this uproarious comedy. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: A mercenary risks his life when he agrees to escort a mysterious young woman with a deadly secret from post-apocalyptic Eastern Europe to New York City(n)

programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Innerspace
programme.desc: Director Joe Dante infuses this science fiction comedy with the visual razzle-dazzle and manic, goofball performances typical of his cartoon-inspired sensibilities. Navy test pilot Lt. Tuck Pendleton (Dennis Quaid) has volunteered for a highly dangerous medical experiment. A submersible craft, with Tuck at the controls, is to be shrunk down to molecular size and inserted into the body of a living rabbit. If successful, the test could result in radical breakthroughs in surgical techniques, but some high-tech thieves attempt to steal Tuck and his ship while both are in miniature form. Enter Jack Putter (Martin Short), a mild-mannered, hypochondriac retail store clerk, a nerd who suddenly finds himself injected with Tuck and his tiny ship. Now poor Jack's got to rise above his mundane existence to help an American hero get back to safety, while also trying to reunite Tuck with his beautiful estranged girlfriend Lydia (Meg Ryan). Innerspace (1987) won an Academy Award for Best Visual Effects(n)

programme.title: Mr. Destiny
programme.desc: James Belushi, Linda Hamilton and Michael Caine star in this endearing fantasy about a down-at-heel working man who attributes his bad luck in life to having struck out on the pitch that would have won the championship for his school baseball team when he was 15. One night he pours his heart out to a barman, who fixes him a magic drink. Suddenly his life is transformed into what it might have been had he won the game(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a young woman for whom getting engaged is only the first step in a nightmare journey through the relationships minefield. Young advertising copywriter Gwyn Marcus (Sarah Jessica Parker) faces the biggest challenge of her life when she decides to accept the marriage proposal of her boyfriend Matt (Gil Bellows)(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a born fighter who is thrown out of the army and winds up training a group of junior cadets. Major Payne (Damon Wayans) is ejected from the army after his commanding officer advises him that he has killed everyone and that there is no one left to fight. In desperation, the fearsome Payne finds a civilian job teaching combat skills to a mixed bunch of kids at a private school - and the results are hilarious!(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Upon Jake's release from prison, the brothers are reunited and visit the orphanage they grew up in--only to discover that it is in danger of being shut down by the county for failure to pay taxes. With a little help from James Brown as a revival preacher, the Blues Brothers are divinely inspired to raise the $5,000 that the orphanage needs to stay open(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: A slacker gets mixed up in a convoluted kidnapping plot with an eccentric millionaire whose name he shares(n)

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: As part of a fertility research project, a male scientist agrees to carry a pregnancy in his own body and becomes very attached to 'his' unborn baby(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: In this clever comedy, romantic complications ensue when an immigrant couple (Elika Portnoy, Carlos Leon) get quickie marriages with their two best friends (Ashley Wolfe, McCaleb Burnett) in order to obtain permanent residency in the United States(n)

programme.title: The Bonfire of the Vanities
programme.desc: Controversial adaptation of Tom Wolfe's acerbic novel. A successful Wall Street trader finds his charmed life turned into a shambles(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Three O'Clock High
programme.desc: The first feature film from director Phil Joanou (State of Grace), Three O' Clock High chronicles a high school nerd's much hyped after-school bout with the infamous class bully. When the impish Jerry Mitchell (Casey Siemaszko) is assigned to interview the new transfer student with a supposedly violent past, Buddy Revell (Richard Tyson), he makes the fatal mistake of touching his subject. Revell, who hates being touched, responds by challenging the unwilling Mitchell to a fight at three o'clock in the parking lot. Spanning the course of the school day, the film follows the disaster-bound Mitchell as he soils his good-boy image through various misguided attempts at averting the fight. Also making noteworthy appearances in the film are Jeffrey Tambor and Philip Baker Hall(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy/ drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing (and the paper's readership). The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

One of the plethora of 1980s teen films, John Hughes's bittersweet 'brat pack' comedy has many perceptive moments(n)

Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: Clean and Sober
programme.desc: Michael Keaton as a substance abuser who checks into a rehab center to avoid the police. Charlie: Kathy Baker. Craig: Morgan Freeman. Richard: M. Emmet Walsh. Lenny: Luca Bercovici. Martin: Brian Benben. Directed by Glenn Cordon Caron(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: The 1982 film version of the John Irving novel The World According to Garp attempts to captures the quirky spirit while condensing the Irving original. Robin Williams plays the title character, the son of unmarried, unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields (Glenn Close, in her film debut). Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp's outlook on life -- she even arranges for him to spend the night with a hooker (Swoosie Kurtz) -- crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to college sweetheart Helen Holm (Mary Beth Hurt), Garp remains envious of his fearless mother, who has taken in the radical "Ellen Jamesians," a group named after a young woman who had her tongue cut out by a rapist. Mutilation, in fact, becomes something of a leitmotif in Garp's life, climaxing (in every sense of the word) in an auto accident brought about by Helen's tryst with Michael Milton (Mark Soper). There is, of course, much more to the story than this: standing out amongst the dozens of offbeat supporting characters is John Lithgow as Roberta Muldoon, a transexual ex-football jock. John Irving appears as a referee during a college wrestling match, while director George Roy Hill plays the pilot whose low-flying plane crashes into Garp's new home. The World According to Garp didn't attract as large an audience as other, more conventional Robin Williams vehicles, though Close and Lithgow would both be nominated for Best Supporting Actor statues(n)

programme.title: Assassins

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

His mission becomes increasingly personal when his partner, Felix Turner (Matt Bomer), begins developing symptoms associated with the virus(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Traditionally, angels are supposed to have snowy wings, spotless flowing robes and be bathed in heavenly light, but not Michael (John Travolta). With a hairy pot belly, long hair, a cigarette addiction, an insatiable sugar craving and filthy wings, the archangel Michael is anything but angelic looking. His unkempt appearance and the fact that he is found holed up in a ramshackle boarding house in a beat-up Iowa backwater, makes it even harder to believe that he is anything but a bum. Still when the publisher of the National Mirror, the country's top tabloid learns there may be an angel afoot, he sends three reporters out to cover the story. Slightly embittered writer Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) hopes the story will bust him out of his slump. Hapless photographer Huey (Robert Pastorelli) worries that one more botched job will cause publisher Vartan Malt (Bob Hoskins) to take away his one lucrative gig shooting celebrity wonder-dog Sparky. The enigmatic Dorothy (Andie MacDowell) is supposedly an expert on all things angelic. Together the disparate trio travel to Iowa and meet Pansy Millbank (Jean Stapleton) the aged owner of a run-down rooming house who tells them how Michael miraculously saved her from financial ruin. In return, she allows him to stay at her place. Naturally, the reporters want to meet this phenomenon, but they are ill-prepared at what groggily stumps down the stairs to greet them. From the stubble-faced, boxer-short wearing, smouldering mess before them, they learn that all high-ranking angels are allowed 26 Earthly vacations for all eternity. This is Michael's final vacation and he wants to have fun. The reporters only want to get as much publicity as they can from their ethereal visitor and so set off with him to Chicago. Along the way, they have many funny misadventures(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: Jonathan and Sara instantly fall in love when they meet in a New York department store while shopping for Christmas presents for their respective partners. They spend one magical evening together, at the end of which, rather than exchanging numbers, they decide to test fate to see if their romance was meant to be. Sara writes her number down in a book which she will sell the next day, and Jon notes his down on a dollar bill, which is immediately spent. They part. It is now up to destiny to bring them back together..(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: Jimmie thinks his wild partying days are numbered, so he proposes to Anne, but botches the proposal so badly that Anne leaves town. After she's gone, Jimmie discovers that his recently-deceased grandfather's will stipulates he gets nothing of a multi-million dollar fortune unless he's married by 6.05pm on his 30th birthday, the very next day!(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: Diane Lane is a wayward wife and Richard Gere is her suspicious husband in Adrian Lyne's Unfaithful. Connie (Lane) leaves her suburban home on an errand, venturing into Manhattan during a wicked windstorm. On a trash-strewn Soho street, she literally runs into Paul Martel (Olivier Martinez), a handsome young Frenchman carrying a huge stack of books. Connie has a bad scrape on her knee, and is unable to get a cab, so Paul invites her up to his apartment. Paul is quietly flirtatious as he gives Connie some ice and a bandage for her knee. Connie phones home and explains to her son, Charlie (Erik Per Sullivan), that she's running late. Before she leaves, Paul gives her a book of Persian poetry, The Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam. She mentions the encounter in passing to Edward (Gere), her husband, but it's clear that she's obsessing about Paul, and soon she's back in the city, with a pretext for calling him up. Soon, they are lovers, and they grow bolder and bolder in their passion. Edward begins to suspect, and eventually gets a private investigator (Dominic Chianese of The Sopranos) to follow Connie. His worst fears confirmed, Edward decides to confront Paul, a decision that will come to haunt him. While the screenplay for Unfaithful is credited to Alvin Sargent (Ordinary People) and William Broyles Jr. (Cast Away), the inspiration for Lyne's film came from Claude Chabrol's acclaimed 1969 film La Femme Infidele(n)

programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Secret Santa. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: The Last Cowboy
programme.desc: Charlie Bankston was a rancher and a cowboy who lived life to the fullest, and in doing so, he created an amazing legacy for those who knew him. But with his passing, the future of his beloved Dry Creek Ranch is uncertain. Charlie left the ranch to his granddaughter, Jake, a woman who long ago fled the homestead and all that it represented. In doing so, she left behind her father, Will, a man whom she blames for her mother's untimely death. Jake has returned now to claim what is rightfully hers - but the truth is that she can't afford to keep it. Can she and her father put aside years of bitterness to save what means the most to them?(n)

She talks about their sparsely-attended wedding and aborted honeymoon, the births of their three children, the bitter custody battle that drove her husband to the brink of bankruptcy; and the attack on herself and Sandra Rivett in November 1974 that led to his disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell reunite more people with long-lost family members. Susan and Chris were childhood sweethearts in 1962 when they discovered they were expecting their first child. Too young to care for the baby themselves, their parents stepped in and arranged an adoption. Having just celebrated their 50th anniversary, they are now united in a search to find their first son. In Poole, former soldier Paul Wright reveals how he was forced to leave his girlfriend and one-year-old daughter in West Germany when he was posted back to the UK in 1985. Eventually losing touch with his family, he now wants to explain to his daughter how the decision to leave was not his.(n)

Plus, out-takes from Ian McKellen and Derek Jacobi's ITV sitcom Vicious.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate a hospital department where three patients have died in suspicious circumstances in six months - the latest being a woman brought into A&E with flu-like symptoms. The detectives learn she died after being given a lethal cocktail of prescription drugs - but with an unsigned patient chart and an extremely busy evening on the ward, tracking down the killer proves challenging. programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the 10th day's play at Roland Garros, where the opening men's and women's quarter-finals are set to take place in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. For the second day in succession at this stage 12 months ago, play was heavily hit by rain, with only two of the already postponed fourth-round matches being completed. Tsventana Pironkova reached the quarter-finals of this tournament for the first time by shocking second seed Agnieska Radwanska with a 2-6, 6-3, 6-3 victory. The lower-ranked player also prevailed in the other contest, with 2010 runner-up Samantha Stosur defeating 2014 finalist Simona Halep 7-6, 6-3. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the 11th day's play at Roland Garros, featuring the concluding men's and women's quarter-finals in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. Day 11 was particularly busy in 2016 due to a backlog of contests caused by heavy rain. Andy Murray was among those who booked their place in the semi-final, prevailing 5-7, 7-6, 6-0, 6-2 against home favourite Richard Gasquet. Eventual women's champion Garbine Muguruza and 2015 title-winner Stan Wawrinka also secured places in the last-four with straight-set victories over Shelby Rogers and Albert Ramos-Vinolas. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.desc: The monsoon season is beginning, and as the first rains start to fall, the tension between Lydia and Ruby is reaching boiling point - driving the younger doctor to make a shocking decision. Maggie's health begins to decline dramatically, and Debbie is adamant that the family must return to the UK. However, Maggie remains determined to remain in India for the time she has left, and struggles to persuade her daughter to honour her last wishes. Conclusion of the medical drama, starring Amrita Acharia and Amanda Redman. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective's former colleague, Sergeant Stuart Macken, is left badly burned when his house is petrol-bombed, while his teenage daughter fights for her life in intensive care. As Vera tries to discover why anyone would attempt to kill Stuart, her investigation leads to unpleasant revelations about his personal life, and she has to face long-buried memories of her own. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley (The Bill) and Julie Graham (William and Mary).(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney takes Geordie to Johnny Johnson's London jazz club, hoping to leave their worries in Grantchester for the night, but the backstage murder of Johnny's sister Claudette puts paid to that. When Archie, the victim's father and owner of the club, calls in a police officer pal to crack the case, Geordie immediately detects the copper is corrupt, while Sidney makes an important discovery about Claudette that she had kept hidden from all but those closest to her. As every lead seems to come back to Archie's violent past, recriminations within the family begin to play out.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Amanda and Guy's wedding fast approaching, and his betrayal of Hildegard still fresh in his mind, Sidney is thrown deep into crisis, and the murder of a local cop doesn't help matters as he allows himself to become drawn into another case with Geordie. However, tragedy strikes as the duo close in on the killer, and with Geordie's life hanging in the balance, the clergyman finds himself cut out of the investigation as the police close ranks. But that doesn't stop him enlisting the help of Mrs Maguire and Leonard in a daring mission to gather information on the man who shot his partner. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 2011 Community Shield: v Manchester City
programme.desc: For only the second time in history the traditional season opener would pit the two Manchester clubs head-to-head, with league winners United taking on FA Cup holders City.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Schrodinger the cat is brought in with a shattered thighbone after being hit by a car, and Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to fuse the broken pieces back together in an all-night operation. Plus, English bulldog Lois is put on a strict diet and given an exercise regimen, and an elderly springer spaniel called Flossie, who has lost control of her back legs, arrives at the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Swan Inn in Pontfadog, a village in the Ceiriog Valley in Wrexham. Ian and Cathy McNeill take their guests trout fishing, and round the day off with a meal in their own restaurant with entertainment from a traditional tenor. However, the next morning is not so harmonious as the guests jostle for access to the only available shower.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Bournemouth, where owners John and Chris Griffith welcome their guests to the Bed & Breakfast by the Beach. The visit gets off to a bad start when hyper-critical Jill is reduced to tears by the discovery that her room does not have a smoke alarm, and the tension continues to mount at dinner, where the hosts regale their guests with racy tales.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Lansbury in Whitby, North Yorkshire. All the guests are keen to have a good look around their rooms after falling victim to owner Jill Winspear's criticism earlier in the week - but her attempts at a guided tour backfire, and the breakfast service fails to impress.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group's final destination is Charlie and Angie Hobson's Castle House in Denbigh, north Wales. Some of the guests are unimpressed by a day trip to a local spa - but back at the B&B, the previously critical Jill is full of praise.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners discover what the other competitors thought of their businesses by opening the cash-filled envelopes, having put in what they believed their hosts should receive. They meet for one last time to learn who has been declared the best value B&B of the week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Nicholas and Pauline Patch, a couple who have frequently holidayed on Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands and are now looking for a second home there. Armed with a budget of £125,000, she shows them around a range of potential properties.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: St Osyth, Essex: Lost Centuries of St Osyth.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit St Osyth, a village close to a 12th-century priory in Essex. However, the settlement itself only dates back to the 15th century and no trace of earlier habitation has ever been found - until now. A boatbuilder has discovered what appears to be the remains of a medieval wharf in the local river, which would suggest a busy town - and the archaeologists have three days to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate the discovery of Roman jewellery and coins in a hilltop field near South Perrott in Dorset, convinced a temple once stood there. However, a search fails to produce any evidence of Roman settlements, instead revealing a Stone Age burial site.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw lead a team of experts who secretly restore classic cars for their unsuspecting owners. They continue by helping Steve, whose health issues have ended his dream of renovating his 1972 Rover P6.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets a pair of civil-partnered university professors in Hertfordshire who have decided to build their first home from scratch. In addition to all the complications this usually entails, Celia Brackenridge and Diana Woodward have also enlisted the services of industrial designers who have developed a new computer-assisted method for cutting precision-engineered building blocks from scratch. However, though the technique may be clever, its creators have never created a building before - meaning everyone involved with the project is taking a giant leap into the unknown.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps homeowners Richard, Jackie and Robert improve their West Sussex properties in the hope that buyer Eliza will make them a lucrative offer.(n)

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Architect Ed Lipton renovates a house for a couple who moved in nine years ago for £220,000, but with two young sons are fast outgrowing the property and cannot afford to move. Ed's bold ideas are held up by planning problems and once the build starts, Rachel and James agree to move out so progress can be quicker, but it has to be completed in just eight weeks. Knocking down the garage and replacing it with a dramatic, double-height extension to give the living space a real sense of drama is one of the potential solutions, although the budget of £60,000 is set to test Ed's skill to the limit.(n)

programme.title: Sex Party Secrets
programme.desc: As the popularity of exclusive arranged orgies rises, this documentary explores the hidden world of the UK's self-proclaimed `sexual elite', providing an insight into the lives of the most selective party planners and their meticulously vetted clients. As the guests sip champagne and fulfil their wildest fantasies behind the doors of multimillion-pound mansions and country estates, the programme explores the motivation behind the desire that drives married couples, young single friends and seasoned sex addicts to seek fleeting intimate experiences and group encounters with strangers.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Angler's Lodge in Island Park, Idaho. Owner Dave Eby built the lodge with his own hands, but a family tragedy has caused him and wife Dede to shy away from the hotel and the community. Gordon is desperate to help mend this broken family - but is it too late to save their business?.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps homeowners Richard, Jackie and Robert improve their West Sussex properties in the hope that buyer Eliza will make them a lucrative offer.(n)

programme.title: Sex Party Secrets
programme.desc: As the popularity of exclusive arranged orgies rises, this documentary explores the hidden world of the UK's self-proclaimed `sexual elite', providing an insight into the lives of the most selective party planners and their meticulously vetted clients. programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits one of Kenya's largest tea plantations and discovers that tea comes in multiple grades and flavours, and every batch can be subtly different. Matt Tebbutt dives in Cornwall for the edible seaweed that has started cropping up on supermarket shelves and Kate Quilton heads to Slovenia and Northern Ireland, eager to learn about the increasing use of rosemary in foodstuffs.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the contemporary Fraoch House in Edinburgh, where Gareth Houston and his mother Heather Davidson hope to impress the guests with their stylish interiors and modern approach to hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A pair of newlywed B&B owners invite their rivals to a traditional establishment in Marple, Greater Manchester, hoping its quaint location will be enough to secure the prize. However, the guests soon make it abundantly clear that it will take more than an idyllic setting to fulfil their expectations.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Suzy Way, the owner of a modern and unconventional B&B near Loughborough, Leicestershire, and her sister Niki Brown prepare an activity-packed day featuring water sport wakeboarding and a home-made curry to win their guests over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Benson is the last to host the group at his B&B in Braintree, Essex, where he hopes his strong business sense and capable manager will make a good impression. A day out at a skidpan track is not to everyone's liking, but dinner is a more relaxed affair, enhanced by spooky stories and a sing-song.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners discover what the other competitors think of their businesses by opening the cash-filled envelopes, which contain what their rivals believe their hosts should receive. They meet for one last time to learn who has won the best value B&B of the week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps prospective buyers Leslie and Helen Hodgkins from Halifax, West Yorkshire, find a second home in Lanzarote with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A visit to Skipsea in East Yorkshire, where a local woman has found artefacts spanning the Neolithic, Roman and Saxon periods, as well as a wealth of material of Norman origin. Exploring the area, Tony Robinson and team believe they have discovered an entire Norman village not mentioned in records. Travelling to nearby Skipsea Castle, they hope to find clues about this mysterious settlement.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: South Shields, Tyneside: Tower Blocks and Togas.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on a dig in South Shields, Tyne and Wear, a town famous for its ancient Roman fort. Archaeologists have found plenty of evidence to suggest the invaders also built a military cemetery in the area, but its probable location is now the site of a housing estate. Enlisting local aid, the experts begin turning over any open space in the neighbourhood - as well as the odd pavement - in search of evidence.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and expert mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit Portsmouth to come to the aid of former Navy diver whose 1976 Triumph Stag is in desperate need of repair.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud oversees the efforts of Jonathan Belsey, a scientist who is trying to build a carbon-neutral home for his partner and their four daughters. The design and construction are risky because they feature untested technology and an uncompromising choice of materials, and he soon finds the costs spiralling out of control.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Andy Macbeth and Jo Denton, Christchurch earthquake refugees, are building a new life and a modern-day fortress against the elements in alpine Queenstown.(n)

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans meets Milt and Judi Taylor, who want to swap their Oregon apartment for a wooden floating home in the forests surrounding Portland, and young couple Roy and Rianne, who are building a floating residence as their starter home to moor in Amsterdam.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Green Berets
programme.desc: The troops at the heart of the harrowing special National Geographic: Inside the Green Berets are far from standard issue military men. As the U.S. soldiers assigned to a outpost in southern Afghanistan christened Firebase Cobra, and required to protect Afghani domestics from the brutal minions of the Taliban, these Berets walk a hair-thin line of risk between life and death, between sanctity and martyrdom. Following 9/11, the U.S. Pentagon restricted this region to the general press for reasons of security and safety, but made a brief, 48-hour exception for members of the National Geographic crew. During that precious span of time, the Taliban indeed struck; two American berets were killed, five others wounded, and members of the camera crew were severely injured as well. Inside the Green Berets presents the footage shot during that two day span, and thus creates an intense and uncompromising glimpse at the lives of the soldiers - the day-to-day risks they traverse, and the heroism they wield - in the said region(n)

programme.title: When Sharks Attack
programme.desc: California Killer. The densely populated coastline of Southern California has suddenly come under attack by natures largest and most ferocious predator. The water-loving populace between Los Angeles and San Diego has never had to fear sharks in the past, making the sudden onslaught of attacks all the more terrifying. As locals struggle to understand why sharks with a taste for human flesh have descended on the region, the attacks become more violent and more frequent, claiming two lives in as many years. While experts begin to solve the mystery, its now a race against the clock to find a way to stop the bloodshed before the beast begins another rampage(n)

programme.desc: Flight nurse Alan O'Riordan is called to Port Macquarie Hospital to transport a patient with a serious heart condition to a bigger facility in Sydney. Mining geologist Elaine Hayde finds herself on a wrong end of a scare while checking gas levels at a gold mine 600km north of Perth. Former Cashel resident Josie Finnegan receives a visit from a lifelong friend from back home, and trainee jockey Louise Day goes for a pre-dawn ride at Caulfield Stables, before meeting a friend in downtown Melbourne to discuss the trials of working in a male-dominated industry.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Two semi-finalists work a shift in Pierre Koffmann's restaurant at the Berkeley hotel in Knightsbridge, central London, before the chef asks them to prepare one of his signature dishes - a confit of salmon with sauteed Bayonne ham and a piperade of tomatoes and green peppers. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: New series. Action drama based on the film franchise. Grief-stricken after the loss of his wife and unborn child, ex-Navy Seal-turned-detective Martin Riggs moves to California to start afresh at the LAPD. He's paired up with veteran detective Roger Murtaugh, who's just coming back to the job after a near-fatal heart attack. Riggs' penchant for diving headfirst into the line of fire soon clashes with Murtaugh's prudent by-the-book technique and his life-on-the-edge attitude makes him a priority case for the department's psychologist. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Riggs and Murtaugh respond to a noise complaint at a party at a heavyweight boxer Hollywood hills home. When gunshots go off, they are drawn into a more important case involving illegal gun-runners with advanced military technology. Riggs becomes personally invested in matters when he discovers one of their targets is a pregnant woman who reminds him of his late wife. Meanwhile, Trish worries about Murtaugh's health, as his partnership with Riggs tests his limits. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star.(n)

programme.title: No Offence
programme.desc: Deering and her squad lose the serial killer case to Maclaren's team after Dinah becomes personally involved with Cathy Calvert, the girl who survived the attack. programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp visits the Central American republic of Honduras, where he makes his way to the city of San Pedro Sula. With a rate of 169 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants last year - an average of more than three people each day - Sula has the dubious distinction of being the most dangerous city on the planet outside of a war zone. Ross discovers how armed drug gangs have taken over many parts of the country, forcing thousands to flee north on a freight train that transports migrants through Guatemala and across Mexico into the United States. But it's an arduous journey and not for the faint-hearted. Even if passengers avoid falling off the roof of the train to their deaths, they face being robbed by bandits, raped, murdered or kidnapped and sold into slavery.(n)

programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Paul's Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor explores Ireland's best hotels, beginning by visiting the beautiful Ashford Castle which provided the setting for the 1952 film The Quiet Man. Together with Classic FM presenter John Suchet, Richard then checks in at the Belfast Europa, which is known as most bombed hotel in Europe after being attacked 28 times during the Troubles, before taking a tour of the Clarence Hotel in Dublin, which is owned by U2 frontman Bono. Finally, he visits the exclusive six-star Ballyfin, where guests are granted the chance to be lord and lady of the manor during their stay.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Stand-alone episode of the political drama, specially penned by creator Aaron Sorkin in response to the attacks on America on September 11. Students visiting the White House are caught up in a security alert involving suspected Islamic extremists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part one of two.
